Issues.Title: HttpHeaders set/append not working.
Issues.Body:
Refer to 'https://angular.io/api/common/http/HttpHeaders', I try to set/append header for my post html.

My code is like:
const header = new HttpHeaders();
header.set(...); // still no headers in header.
header.append(...); // still no headers in header.

I check the header variable and still no headers inside.
Please fix it Angular team, because I'm really sure it's bugs.

I create a new issue because this issue 'https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/19044' is already closed without resolution.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "HttpHeaders set/append not working." (#33033)

Issues.Title: docs: correct sentence in AoT compiler guide
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
In the AoT compiler guide (https://angular.io/guide/aot-compiler#supported-classes-and-functions) the following sentence can be found:

> The compiler can only create instances certain classes, supports only core decorators, and only supports calls to macros (functions or static methods) that return expressions.

The part _"**...can only create instances certain classes...**"_ is grammatically incorrect.

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?

> The compiler can only create instances **of** certain classes, supports only core decorators, and only supports calls to macros (functions or static methods) that return expressions.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): avoid exposing `ng` with Closure Compiler enhanced optimizations
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, `ng` was exposed in global namespace, which turned out to be problematic when minifying code with Closure, since it sometimes clobber our `ng` global. This commit aligns Ivy debugging tools behavior with existing logic in "platform-browser" package (packages/platform-browser/src/dom/util.ts#L31) by avoiding `ng` in global namespace when Closure Compiler is used.

Similar change was originally introduced in https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/a7798f2.

Note: if we want to expose debugging tools in Closure at some point in the future, we should be able to do that using a different namespace (like `ngDevTools`).

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: BUG: IVY ViewContainerRef does not remove item with animation (Route)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
`@angular/core`
`@angular/common`
`@angular/animations`
`@angular/router`

Probably one of these

### Is this a regression?
I am not sure, but i think it was working without IVY, so it is possible that it is regression.

### Description

When you have route with animation (little complex animation) on component which is routet, after changing route, new component appear next to old component which is not removed and this will stack.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

> `clone https://github.com/kukjevov/ng-universal-demo.git`
> `cd ng-universal-demo`
> `git checkout ivy-error`
> `npm install`
> `npm start`
> open browser at `http://localhost:8888`
> click on garden link
> click on *Garden* link
> click on *Home* link
> click on *Garden* link
> click on *Home* link
> click on *Garden* link
> click on *Home* link

then you will see that `home-view` will be there multiple times (it is not removed after changing route)

## üî• Exception or Error

No exception just not removed component from view.

**Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: Type 'SafeHtml' is not assignable to type 'string'
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/platform-browser ### Is this a regression? This is kind of regression - please see description bellow. ### Description I am getting **Typescript error** after switching to *Ivy compiler*: ```bash [Step 4/5] src/app/app.component.html(1,26): Type 'SafeHtml' is not assignable to type 'string'. ``` In Angular class there is a member property declared as `SafeHtml`: ```typescript @Component({ selector: 'app', template: `
` }) export class AppComponent { description: SafeHtml; constructor(private sanitizer: DomSanitizer) {} ngOnInit(): void { this.description = this.sanitizer.sanitize(SecurityContext.HTML, 'whatever comes from server'); } } ``` My issue is how to convert `SafeHtml` and `SafeUrl` to string, so that strict template check does not emits an error - I would like to avoid calling `.toString()` on the `description` - it should work out of the box - at least it is my expectation. Angular `SafeHtml` is declared as: ```typescript /** * Marker interface for a value that's safe to use as HTML. * * @publicApi */ export declare interface SafeHtml extends SafeValue { } ``` And `innerHtml` defined in _lib.dom.d.ts_: ```typescript interface InnerHTML { innerHTML: string; } ``` The `innerHtml` is type of `string`, whereas I have `SafeHtml`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction How to reproduce: ```bash git clone https://github.com/felikf/angular-repro-safe-html.git npm i npm run build ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 

Type 'SafeHtml' is not assignable to type 'string'

Issues.Title: Add `Location.urlChanges` as Observable<{url, state}>
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/common




### Description

Currently, `Location` class exposes `onUrlChange` event listener. To get URL changes as `Observable`, we have to create own wrapper service. And this is a common use case; to reflect URL to title, meta data, or etc...

`Router.events` is like this but URL change event doesn't depend on Router. It should just wrap platform's location change.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add `Location.urlChanges` field.

```ts
class Location {
  readonly urlChanges: Observable<{url: string; state: unknown}>;
}
```


### Describe alternatives you've considered

Current workaround

```ts
const urlChanges$ = new Subject();
location.onUrlChange((url) => {
  urlChanges$.next(url);
});
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add `Location.urlChanges` as Observable<{url, state}>" (#33021)

* `RootRenderer` has been removed. Use `RendererFactory2` instead.

Issues.Title: refactor(core): typo in undecorated-classes-with-di AOT failure message
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)

- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
There is an extra period in the error message for `MIGRATION_AOT_FAILURE` as [the string](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/01677b21b6ae057f8987b5d17c862286a3763615/packages/core/schematics/migrations/undecorated-classes-with-di/index.ts#L29) and [the template](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/01677b21b6ae057f8987b5d17c862286a3763615/packages/core/schematics/migrations/undecorated-classes-with-di/index.ts#L174) it's used in both include a terminating period.
```
Please ensure there are no AOT compilation errors and rerun the migration.. The following project failed: tsconfig.app.json
```

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
```

Issues.Title: feat(compiler-cli): resolve type of exported *ngIf variable.
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature

- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
Angular compiler does not resolve the type of exported variable from *ngIf directive. It always returns `any` type. So language service can't provide completions for type members.

Issue Number: angular/vscode-ng-language-service#255


## What is the new behavior?
Compiler will try resolve type of exported variable and will use this type for type-checking.  Angular language service will use this type for completions, go to definition and quick info functionality. Also language service will provide more accurate diagnostic errors during development.

- [ ] Yes

Issues.Title: refactor(core): missing-injectable migration should respect providers of directives and components
Issues.Body:
Currenly the `missing-injectable` migration only migrates providers referenced from
`@NgModule` definitions. The schematic currently does not cover the migration for
providers referenced in `@Directive` or `@Component` definitions.

We need to handle `providers` for both `@Directive` and `@Component`. Additionally
for components we need to respect the `viewProviders` field.

This commit ensures that the migration handles providers for these definitions.

Issues.Title: fix(common): ensures hash location strategy includes current path fro‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶m window.location.pathname

Previously with HashLocationStrategy, any url updates were only made with the hash, for example when the routerLink directives updates the href on anchor tags or in calls to history.pushState or history.replaceState. In the case that a base href is set though, the browser will actually update the url path in the address bar with the path included in the base href. During client side hash routing, this causes unexpected behavior. By always including the current location.pathname in history updates, this ensures that HashRouting will never cause a change to anything before the hash, which is what one would expect.

Fixes #33000

Issues.Title: make angular-automatic-lock-bot lock issues only on activity
Issues.Body:
Every time the "angular-automatic-lock-bot" locks an issue that I was involved with, I receive a notification. This might be considered useless/annoying since it does not add any new information concerning the original issue. 

I understand of course that locking an issue is important in order to prevent people from "out-of-scope-discussing" (and notifying others) on an old issue. Nevertheless, notifying people about that fact that they will not be receiving any more notifications is somewhat undermining the original purpose. 

**Proposal: The issue should be kept open and only be locked after someone comments on it and a notification was sent out anyway.**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "make angular-automatic-lock-bot lock issues only on activity" (#15771)

Issues.Title: Ivy CSS @import requires exact file names
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [x ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Is this a regression?

Yes, works pre-Ivy

### Description

9.0.0-next.6 CSS/SCSS @import statements do not resolve file names unless they are exact.
For example, pre-Ivy I could import the file `_variables.scss` with `@import './variables';`. In Ivy it must be `./_variables.scss`.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Migrate a project from version 8 to 9.0.0-next.6 that has CSS imports that omit *.scss or _'s from the import statements.

```
This migration uses the Angular compiler internally and therefore projects that no longer build
successfully after the update cannot run the migration. Please ensure there are no AOT compilation
errors and rerun the migration.. The following project failed: src/tsconfig.app.json
            
            Error: error TS100: Couldn't resolve resource ../../assets/scss/common/component.common
from /.../src/app/common/app-header.component.scss
Migration can be rerun with: "ng update @angular/core --from 8.0.0 --to 9.0.0 --migrate-only"
            Successfully migrated all found undecorated classes
            that use dependency injection.
```

No longer available. Bug created after the fact on request of @Splaktar

Issues.Title: Issue with `fullTemplateTypeCheck` and `ng serve`
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? I don't know. ### Description When having `fullTemplateTypeCheck` enabled in `tsconfig.json` and running `ng serve` everything runs fine initially. I might, for example, get nice error messages about my template type-check issues (with colors and everything :smiley:): ``` ERROR in src/app/app.component.html:38:66 - error TS2322: Type 'SearchResults | null' is not assignable to type 'SearchResults | undefined'. Type 'null' is not assignable to type 'SearchResults | undefined'. 38 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ src/app/app.component.ts:23:16 23 templateUrl: './app.component.html', ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent. ``` Then on re-compiling (e.g. after editing a file and saving), I get the following error: ``` ERROR in ./src/main.ts at plugin.done.then ([...]\angular\aio\node_modules\@ngtools\webpack\src\loader.js:41:31) at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:68:7) ERROR in ./src/polyfills.ts Module build failed (from ./node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/index.js): Error: [...]\angular\aio\src\polyfills.ts is missing from the TypeScript compilation. Please make sure it is in your tsconfig via the 'files' or 'include' property. at AngularCompilerPlugin.getCompiledFile ([...]\angular\aio\node_modules\@ngtools\webpack\src\angular_compiler_plugin.js:918:23) at plugin.done.then ([...]\angular\aio\node_modules\@ngtools\webpack\src\loader.js:41:31) at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:68:7) i ÔΩ¢wdmÔΩ£: Failed to compile. ``` I might then get some error template type-check errors, but not as nicely formatted (or colorful) as before: ``` ERROR in src/app/app.component.html(38,66): error TS2322: Type 'SearchResults | null' is not assignable to type 'SearchResults | undefined'. Type 'null' is not assignable to type 'SearchResults | undefined'. src/app/app.component.html(47,63): error TS2322: Type 'NavigationNode[]' is not assignable to type 'Option[]'. Type 'NavigationNode' is not assignable to type 'Option'. Types of property 'title' are incompatible. Type 'string | undefined' is not assignable to type 'string'. Type 'undefined' is not assignable to type 'string'. src/app/app.component.html(47,87): error TS2322: Type 'NavigationNode' is not assignable to type 'Option'. src/app/custom-elements/api/api-list.component.html(24,8): error TS2322: Type 'ApiSection[] | null' is not assignable to type 'ApiSection[] | Iterable | undefined'. ... ``` After this first error, the app is not re-compiled when I make changes (I have to stop the process and run `ng serve` anew). (NOTE: The error seems only (or much more often) happen when there _are_ template type-check errors.) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction It started happening for me in PR angular/angular#32980. To reproduce, you could: 1. Check out the PR. 2. Reset to the commit before ``build(docs-infra): enable `fullTemplateTypeCheck` (and fix failures)`` (currently https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/32980/commits/3f228a626). 3. Add `fullTemplateTypeCheck: true` in `aio/tsconfig.json > angularCompilerOptions`. 4. Run `yarn --cwd=aio && yarn --cwd=aio start`. _(You should see some nice template type-check error messages.)_ 5. Open `aio/src/app/app.component.ts`, make a change and save it. _(You should see the error.)_ (NOTE: If that reproduction isn't helpful, I can try to create a minimal one with a new app.) ## üåç Your Environment (NOTE: I am on 9.0.0-next.8 now, but this happened with 9.0.0-next.6 as well.) 

Angular CLI: 9.0.0-next.8
Node: 10.16.3
OS: win32 x64

Issues.Title: fail with library use angular8 loadChildren format
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... No, it's just come up with angular8 new loadChildren format ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... when I try to use `import(...)` to lazyload route in library, it come up with error, I think the reason is rollup configuration for library doesn't support multiple chunk, when I change to use old loadChildren format like `loadChildren: './admin-user-login.module#AdminUserLoginModule'` it's works well ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. generate a route as a library ```s ng g library admin-user-login ``` 2. add route define for module ```ts // projects/admin-user-login/src/lib/admin-user-login.route.ts import { Route, Routes } from '@angular/router'; import { AdminUserLoginComponent } from './admin-user-login.component'; export const AdminUserLoginRouteEntry: Route = { path: 'login', // loadChildren: './admin-user-login.module#AdminUserLoginModule', // works well async loadChildren() { const { AdminUserLoginModule } = await import('./admin-user-login'); // error, because import make multiple chunks. return AdminUserLoginModule; }, } export const AdminUserLoginRouteChildren: Routes = [ { path: '', component: AdminUserLoginComponent, } ] // projects/admin-user-login/src/lib/admin-user-login.module.ts import { NgModule } from '@angular/core'; import { AdminUserLoginComponent } from './admin-user-login.component'; import { RouterModule } from '@angular/router'; import { AdminUserLoginRouteChildren } from './admin-user-login.route'; @NgModule({ declarations: [AdminUserLoginComponent], imports: [ RouterModule.forChild(AdminUserLoginRouteChildren), ], exports: [AdminUserLoginComponent] }) export class AdminUserLoginModule { } // projects/admin-user-login/src/public-api.ts /* * Public API Surface of admin-user-login */ export * from './lib/admin-user-login.service'; export * from './lib/admin-user-login.component'; export * from './lib/admin-user-login.module'; export * from './lib/admin-user-login.route'; ``` 3. run build ```s ng build admin-user-login ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 



ERROR: You must set "output.dir" instead of "output.file" when generating multiple chunks.
An unhandled exception occurred: You must set "output.dir" instead of "output.file" when generating multiple chunks.
See "/private/var/folders/gn/mbh35twj2yl1cbb9dszc7sm40000gn/T/ng-G9tuPy/angular-errors.log" for further details.

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): don't use getImportTslibTransformer
Issues.Body:
This transformer can cause size regressions when it introduces `tslib` imports across independent chunks.

It should be deprecated because tslib adoption has become more ubiquitous.

Should also speed up Build Optimizer processing time because there's one less thing to do.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): don't use getImportTslibTransformer" (#15749)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): re-introduce pure_getters
Issues.Body:
PR #15607 removed the `_pure_getters` optimization as it no longer has effect on the framework size.
But it does have an effect on third party library.

For example a simple project using `@ng-bootstrap/ng-bootstrap` goes from `444K` uncompressed with CLI `9.0.0-next.5` to `488K` with CLI `9.0.0-next.6` which introduced the removal.

Issues.Title: Mat-Select with Ag-Grid on Edge
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://angular-vt3fhy.stackblitz.io

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click on cell in Edge
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Select box is approximately the same width as the cell.


#### Actual Behavior

Select box is the width of the entire grid.

I believe the problem lies in this line of code:
`this._triggerRect = this.trigger.nativeElement.getBoundingClientRect();`
In Chrome, the trigger element is the cell, but in Edge, I believe it is the grid itself.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.9
- CDK/Material: 8.2.2
- Browser(s): Edge 44 (but not present in 42)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10

Issues.Title: Talkback announces wrong state on radio button selection
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. Load https://material.angular.io/components/radio/examples on android chrome browser
2. Start Talkback
3. Select 'Autumn' option from the first example (talkback reads 'Selected')
4. Navigate to 'Summer' (talkback reads 'Summer radio button not selected')
5. Select 'Summer' (talkback reads 'Not selected')
6. Select 'Autumn' again (talkback reads 'Selected')
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
When selecting a **previous** radio button, talkback should announce the correct state, 'Selected'

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
When selected a **previous** radio button, talkback announces it's previous state

#### Environment

- Angular: latest
- CDK/Material: latest
- Browser(s): Mobile Chrome, Android WebView
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Android
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Talkback announces wrong state on radio button selection" (#17319)

Issues.Title: build: changelog should not show changes to google-maps
Issues.Body:
We don't release the google-maps package and disabled the
package group in the changelog. Apparently there is a bug where
we do not detect commits as google-maps changes if the commit
format does not specify an explicit package, but rather just a scope.

We usually determine the package based on the scope by looking
for matching packages. This did not work for `google-maps` changes
such as 30de283
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: changelog should not show changes to google-maps" (#17313)

Issues.Title: MatPaginatedTabHeader has performance problems (forced synchronous layout).
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  open Chrome dev tools / Performance
2. start recording a profile and go to https://next.angular.io/guide/router
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

`MatPaginatedTabHeader` should not be the perf hot spot / bottleneck for AIO

#### Actual Behavior

The [_checkPaginationEnabled](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/8c9801398c9593cc29c292d65bd206463909a432/src/material/tabs/paginated-tab-header.ts#L462-L475) methods triggers a forced synchronous layout (by doing `const isEnabled = this._tabList.nativeElement.scrollWidth > this._elementRef.nativeElement.offsetWidth;`.

This forced synchronous layout accounts for **~38% of the entire JS processing time on the critical TTI path** (see attached recording). Similar bottlenecks were spotted on other profiled sites (ex. https://www.mustakbil.com/)

[Dev tools profile recording](https://github.com/angular/components/files/3698146/aio_mat_tab_forced_layout.json.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatPaginatedTabHeader has performance problems (forced synchronous layout). " (#17317)

Issues.Title: Strange Subscriber Memory Leak when using mat-radio-group
Issues.Body:
I'm not sure why this is happening and can't see an obvious reason but when I use  mat-radio-group in my template I seem to get and big Subscriber memory leak, and if I remove mat-radio-group that leak no longer occurs.
![Screenshot 2019-10-06 at 13 06 52](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/811652/66269087-4aac5300-e83c-11e9-86df-93e466c389a7.png)
```
  <mat-radio-group [formControl]="shopService.sort" aria-label="Select an option">
    <mat-radio-button [value]="option.query" *ngFor="let option of shopService.sortOptions">{{option.title}}
    </mat-radio-button>

``` 
if I remove the mat-radio-group so I just have the mat-radio-button I also don't get the leak. i.e
```
   <mat-radio-button [value]="option.query" *ngFor="let option of shopService.sortOptions">{{option.title}}

Just a bit confused as to why this would be happening.

Issues.Title: feat(drag-drop): allow for custom class to be set on preview
Issues.Body:
When we create a preview for a dragged element, we put it in the `body` in order to avoid issues with `z-index` and `overflow`, however this makes it harder to style the element. When the previews were implemented initially, the thinking was the users could customize it either by providing a custom preview, in which case they can set as many classes as they want, or by targeting something like `.some-element.cdk-drag-preview` if they're using the default one. The problem with the latter is that it doesn't allow for something like a theme to be propagated to the preview.

These changes add an extra input that allows users to set a class on the preview element for easier customization.

Fixes #17089.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(drag-drop): allow for custom class to be set on preview" (#17304)

Issues.Title: fix(form-field): outline gap not calculated in shadow dom
Issues.Body:
Currently we check whether the form field is inside the DOM using `documentElement.contains(formField)` so that we don't try to calculate the outline gap. The problem is that `contains` won't catch elements inside the shadow DOM. These changes rework the check to use `getRootNode` instead.

Fixes #17262.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(form-field): outline gap not calculated in shadow dom" (#17303)

Issues.Title: refactor(collections): remove deprecated APIs for 9.0.0
Issues.Body:
Removes the breaking changes for 9.0 from the `cdk/collections` entry point. Also renames the file with the `SelectionModel` so it's consistent with the class that it contains.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* `SelectionModel.onChange` has been removed. Use `SelectionModel.changed` instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(collections): remove deprecated APIs for 9.0.0" (#17302)

Issues.Title: feat(drag-drop): allow drag start delay to be configured based on event type
Issues.Body:
Allows the consumer to configure the drag start delay based on whether it's a touch event or mouse event.

Fixes #17260.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(drag-drop): allow drag start delay to be configured based on event type" (#17301)

Issues.Title: fix(dialog): don't move focus if it was moved during close animation
Issues.Body:
Currently we restore focus to the previously-focused element once the dialog's exit animation has completed, however this can override any focus management the consumer might have done while the animation was running. These changes add extra check so that we only move focus if it was inside the dialog at the end of the animation.

Fixes #17296.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(dialog): don't move focus if it was moved during close animation" (#17300)

Issues.Title: Dialog should not restore focus when it doesn't have the focus anymore
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Open a material dialog
2. Call .close() on its ref
3. Synchronously move the focus to some element in your UI (not in the dialog).

Expected: 
The focus should remain where you put it.

Actual:
Asynchronously (when the close animation finishes), the dialog will restore focus to whatever element happened to have focus before the dialog was opened.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
This behavior is unexpected.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Closure UI does it the way I suggest (it's where I got the idea): https://github.com/google/closure-library/blob/master/closure/goog/ui/modalpopup.js#L541
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dialog should not restore focus when it doesn't have the focus anymore" (#17296)

Issues.Title: build: generate api docs for all tertiary entry-points
Issues.Body:
Updates our Dgeni setup to generate API docs for all entry-points
which are configured in the `cdk/config.bzl` or `material/config.bzl` file. 

This basically means that we now generate API docs for `material/*/testing`
entry-points and for `cdk/testing/*`.

Removes the code that made `cdk/testing` a separate sub package. This
involves more code than just treating it as "real" entry-point (for which we generate bundles etc.).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: generate api docs for all tertiary entry-points" (#17293)

Issues.Title: Disable a mat-step within Horizontal and Vertical Stepper
Issues.Body:
Description: I am submitting a feature request to add a simple [disable] property to a mat-step. This would allow you to pass in a boolean that's maintained in your component to disable or enable a mat-step dynamically. 

Use Case: I've come across a situation where I need to navigate to the third step of a horizontal stepper on 'view'. So basically skip all the creation and editing steps and just go straight to the step that shows my summary of what I've done. I searched for a while to try to find a nice way to disable a mat-step. People were suggesting using the [completed] or [editable] properties but none of those disabled the step. I was able to still navigate to it if and edit fields if I clicked on it. What I ended up doing was dynamically hiding the headers using css and [ngClass]. Obviously this is a bit of a hacky workaround and I'd love to just be able to disable the step by passing it a 'viewMode' boolean which I'm doing for other areas of the component to show and hide content I want the user to see based on what mode they're in. The UX designers at my company want to be able to see the other steps even though we wouldn't be able to navigate to them to keep the same look and feel. So essentially just make the header of the mat-step not clickable. I've hidden all the headers now as a temporary solution when user is in viewMode. Another problem with my workaround is I'm having to add a bunch of other styles that will be applied in viewMode because the headers take up a good 1/8th of my MatDialog so when they're not there, I found that I had to use [ngClass] in multiple areas. 

I hadn't found a better workaround then [ngClass] for this problem I'm having. If anyone has a better solution, I'd love to hear it.

Thanks

Don Miko
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Disable a mat-step within Horizontal and Vertical Stepper" (#17294)
